endpoints.description: Return basic information about the API

endpoints.name: /agents
endpoints.description: Return information about all available agents or a list of them

query.name: agents_list
query.description: List of agent IDs (separated by comma), all agents selected by default if not specified

query.name: ip
query.description: Filter by the IP used by the agent to communicate with the manager. If it's not available, it will have the same value as registerIP

query.name: limit
query.description: Maximum number of elements to return. Although up to 100.000 can be specified, it is recommended not to exceed 500 elements. Responses may be slower the more this number is exceeded.

query.name: manager
query.description: Filter by manager hostname where agents are connected to

query.name: offset
query.description: First element to return in the collection

query.name: older_than
query.description: Filter out agents whose time lapse from last keep alive signal is longer than specified. Time in seconds, ‘[n_days]d’, ‘[n_hours]h’, ‘[n_minutes]m’ or ‘[n_seconds]s’. For never_connected agents, uses the register date. For example, `7d`, `10s` and `10` are valid values. If no time unit is specified, seconds are used

query.name: q
query.description: Query to filter results by. For example q="status=active"

query.name: registerIP
query.description: Filter by the IP used when registering the agent

query.name: search
query.description: Look for elements containing the specified string. To obtain a complementary search, use '-' at the beginning

query.name: select
query.description: Select which fields to return (separated by comma). Use '.' for nested fields. For example, '{field1: field2}' may be selected with 'field1.field2'

query.name: sort
query.description: Sort the collection by a field or fields (separated by comma). Use +/- at the beggining to list in ascending or descending order. Use '.' for nested fields. For example, '{field1: field2}' may be selected with 'field1.field2'

query.name: status
query.description: Filter by agent status (use commas to enter multiple statuses)

endpoints.name: /agents/:agent_id/config/:component/:configuration
endpoints.description: Return the active configuration the agent is currently using. This can be different from the configuration present in the configuration file, if it has been modified and the agent has not been restarted yet

args.name: :agent_id
args.description: Agent ID. All possible values from 000 onwards

args.name: :configuration
args.description:
Selected agent's configuration to read. The configuration to read depends on the selected component. The following table shows all available combinations of component and configuration values:

Component Configuration Tag
agent client <client>
agent buffer <client_buffer>
agent labels <labels>
agent internal <agent>, <monitord>, <remoted>
agentless agentless <agentless>
analysis global <global>
analysis active_response <active-response>
analysis alerts <alerts>
analysis command <command>
analysis rules <rule>
analysis decoders <decoder>
analysis internal <analysisd>
auth auth <auth>
com active-response <active-response>
com logging <logging>
com internal <execd>
com cluster <cluster>
csyslog csyslog <csyslog_output>
integrator integration <integration>
logcollector localfile <localfile>
logcollector socket <socket>
logcollector internal <logcollector>
mail global <global><email...>
mail alerts <email_alerts>
mail internal <maild>
monitor global <global>
monitor internal <monitord>
monitor internal <reports>
request global <global>
request remote <remote>
request internal <remoted>
syscheck syscheck <syscheck>
syscheck rootcheck <rootcheck>
syscheck internal <syscheck>, <rootcheck>
wmodules wmodules <wodle>

args.name: :configuration
args.description:
Selected agent's configuration to read. The configuration to read depends on the selected component. The following table shows all available combinations of component and configuration values:

Component Configuration Tag
agent client <client>
agent buffer <client_buffer>
agent labels <labels>
agent internal <agent>, <monitord>, <remoted>
agentless agentless <agentless>
analysis global <global>
analysis active_response <active-response>
analysis alerts <alerts>
analysis command <command>
analysis rules <rule>
analysis decoders <decoder>
analysis internal <analysisd>
auth auth <auth>
com active-response <active-response>
com logging <logging>
com internal <execd>
com cluster <cluster>
csyslog csyslog <csyslog_output>
integrator integration <integration>
logcollector localfile <localfile>
logcollector socket <socket>
logcollector internal <logcollector>
mail global <global><email...>
mail alerts <email_alerts>
mail internal <maild>
monitor global <global>
monitor internal <monitord>
monitor internal <reports>
request global <global>
request remote <remote>
request internal <remoted>
syscheck syscheck <syscheck>
syscheck rootcheck <rootcheck>
syscheck internal <syscheck>, <rootcheck>
wmodules wmodules <wodle>

endpoints.description: Add an agent specifying its name, ID and IP. If an agent with the same name, the same ID or the same IP already exists, replace it using `force_time` parameter

body.name: force
body.description: Remove the old agent with the same name, ID or IP if the configuration is matched

value.description: Time the agent must has been disconnected to force the insertion. Time in seconds, ‘[n_days]d’, ‘[n_hours]h’, ‘[n_minutes]m’ or ‘[n_seconds]s’. For example, `7d`, `10s` and `10` are valid values. If no time unit is specified, seconds are used

after_registration_time.description: Time the agent must has been registered to force the insertion. Time in seconds, ‘[n_days]d’, ‘[n_hours]h’, ‘[n_minutes]m’ or ‘[n_seconds]s’. For example, `7d`, `10s` and `10` are valid values. If no time unit is specified, seconds are used

body.name: ip
body.description: If this is not included, the API will get the IP automatically. Allowed values: IP, IP/NET, ANY

body.name: key
body.description: Key to use when communicating with the manager. The agent must have the same key on its `client.keys` file
